content: एक {%<ab>pron. a.</ab>%} [इ-कन्] {@--1@} One, single, alone, only; <ls>Bh. 3. 14.</ls> {@--2@} Not accompanied by any one; <ls>U. 2. 28.</ls> {@--3@} The same, one and the same, identical; एकान्वयो मम <ls>Ś. 7</ls>; मनस्येकं वचस्येकं कर्मण्येकं महात्मनां <ls>H. 1. 101.</ls> {@--4@} Firm, unchanged; <ls>Pt. 1. 260.</ls> {@--5@} Single of its kind, unique, singular. {@--6@} Chief, supreme, prominent, sole; °पार्थिव, °धनुर्धरः, °ऐश्वर्य <ls>M. 1. 1</ls> sole sovereignty; एको रागिषु राजते <ls>Bh. 3. 121.</ls> {@--7@} Peerless, matchless. {@--8@} One of two or many; <ls>Me. 30</ls>, <ls n="Me.">78.</ls> {@--9@} Oft. used like the English indefinite article ‘a’ or ‘an’; ज्योतिरेकं <ls>Ś. 5. 30.</ls> {@--10@} True. {@--11@} Little. Oft. used in the middle of <ab>comp.</ab> in the sense of ‘only’, with an adjectival or adverbial force; दोषैकदृक् looking only to faults; त्वदेकेषु <ls>Ku. 3. 15</ls> your arrow only; so भोगैकबद्धस्पृहः. एकः-अन्यः, or अपरः the one-the other; it is used in the plural in the sense of some, its correlative being अन्ये or अपरे (others); <ls>Śi. 12. 45</ls>; see अन्य, अपर also. --कः <ab>N.</ab> of Viṣṇu, the Supreme being. --का <ab>N.</ab> of Durgā. [<ab>cf.</ab> Persian {%yak%}; <ab>L.</ab> {%œquus%}].
